text: Jerold T. Hevener (April 30, 1873, date of death unknown) was an American film actor and director. He appeared in 36 films and directed a further 18 between 1912 and 1917. He was born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. ==Selected filmography== ===As an actor=== *The Dream of a Moving Picture Director (1912) * All for a Girl (1915) as Count Barony * A Terrible Tragedy (1916) * Edison Bugg's Invention (1916) * Her Choice (1915) * Matilda's Legacy (1915) * A Lucky Strike (1915) * Cupid's Target (1915) * What He Forgot (1915) * Jealous James (1914) * A Fool There Was (1914) * He Won a Ranch (1914) * Building a Fire (1914) * A Prize Package (1912) * The Widow Casey's Return (1912) ===As a director=== * It Happened in Pikesville (1916) * A Terrible Tragedy (1916) * Edison Bugg's Invention (1916) * The Crazy Clock Maker (1915) * The Prize Baby (1915) * Cupid's Target (1915) * What He Forgot (1915) * The Soubrette and the Simp (1914) * The Smuggler's Daughter (1914) * The Female Cop (1914) ==External links== * *portraits Category:1873 births Category:Year of death missing Category:American male film actors Category:American film directors Category:20th-century American male actors Category:Male actors from Philadelphia
title: Jerold T. Hevener
